primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The trial of Jesus as a cosmic contest between the 'Truth' of the God of the Covenant and the 'Fake Truth' of Imperial Power (Rome/Greed/Violence).

subject.identificatie: Jesus (as the embodiment of the God of Israel)
tekstueel_bewijs: He contradicts the claims of the governor
He welcomed those of every tribe
determine who is telling the truth
the drama of mercy, compassion, and restorative justice

zender.identificatie: The God of the Covenant / The Emancipator
tekstueel_bewijs: This is the God who showed up as the emancipator in the slave camps of Egypt
This is the God of widows who have no other advocate
it tasted to them like new life
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the 'Jury' who must decide the verdict.

tekstueel_bewijs: They remembered that they had some leftovers... it tasted to them like new life
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject acting through Jesus.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the power of memory/re-enactment.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Empire / Pilate / The Mob / White Supremacy / Greed
tekstueel_bewijs: He is a perfect icon of great power
the imperial power of greed and violence
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a person but a systemic 'world' that offers a 'fake truth' competing for the soul of the world.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Hearer's Trial: The audience must decide which 'Truth' to follow based on the outcome of Jesus' trial.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / 'We'
secundair_narratief_programma.object: The Verdict (Choosing the Truth of Jesus over Empire)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (Jesus' work) provides the data, but the secondary program (Hearer's decision) is the climax of the sermon's rhetorical intent.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God of Covenant → Truth/Justice → The Vulnerable/Hearer

voorbeelden_god_subject: This is the God who showed up as the emancipator
He welcomed those of every tribe
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we get to decide the verdict

voorbeelden: nothing in his appearance that we should desire him
determine who is telling the truth
did they understand who he was
I have power to release you
his authority is not derived from Rome

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is an epistemological crisis. It focuses on 'knowing' the difference between two worldviews (Truth vs. Fake Truth).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Pilate's power) to ~S2 (Jesus' weakness) to S1 (The Truth of the Covenant).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by identifying Jesus as the embodiment of the God who acts for the marginalized, making the Cross the 'pivot point'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; Empire is described as a massive, impressive, and seductive system.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it ends with a call to 'decide', the engine of the sermon is theocentric. God is the one who shows up in Egypt, Babylon, and the Cross. Jesus is the active Subject of the Gospel verbs.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: we get to decide the verdict

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: This is the God who showed up as the emancipator
He stands in for raw male power... money power... white power

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is not a model for us to imitate, but a 'stand-in' for God's character.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Jesus reveals the nature of God's justice.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: A sense of being 'seen' by a God who advocates for the vulnerable.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is defined as liberation from oppressive 'fake truths'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical trial to the contemporary 'verdict' is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between Jesus' 'kingdom not from here' and the very 'here' political applications (white power, etc).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: A contest to determine who is telling the truth... he contradicts the claims of the governor.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon relies on the 'memory' of the meal to provide power.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is identified as the 'Empire' of greed, violence, and supremacy.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Jesus as the Subject of the primary narrative. The hearer is the Receiver of the 'Truth' but is called to a secondary Subject role in 'deciding' their allegiance.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer is occasionally positioned as a 'Judge' of God.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The hearer as the 'Wounded' for whom Jesus was bruised.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Deepen the Isaiah 53 connection to show the hearer as the beneficiary of the wounding.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Pouvoir (The power to live this truth)
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on how the 'broken bread' gives the hearer the *Pouvoir* (power) to resist Empire.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent (Empire) is already sufficiently heavy.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The hierarchy of God's action leading to our decision is well-maintained.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful theocentric sermon that uses structural contrast to highlight the radical nature of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Empire' metaphors; Greimas shows that these metaphors function as the 'Opponent' actant in a cosmic drama.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Johannine text; Greimas shows how the preacher maps the Johannine actants onto modern social actants.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Truth' is not a static concept but an 'Object' being fought over by two competing 'Subjects' (Jesus vs. Pilate).

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'moralistic' trap by making the 'Truth' an act of God's character rather than a set of rules for the hearer.
